description: Product t2(q^d); d | 32, where t2 = theta2(q)/(2*q^(1/4)).
comments: theta_2 is the standard Jacobi theta-constant function,  Sum_{m=-oo..oo} q^((m+1/2)^2) = 2*q^(1/4)*(1+q^2+q^6+q^12+q^20+q^30+...) - see A098108.Thus the above function t2 equals t2(z) = 1 + z^2 + z^6 + z^12 + ... = sum_{n>=0} z^(n(n+1)) = sum_{n>=0} z^A002378(n). But note that the sequence lists only the nonzero coefficients which are those of even powers. In other words, this is the sequence of coefficients of product(t'(x^2^d), d=0..5) with t'(z) = 1 + z + z^3 + z^6 + ... = sum_{n>=0} z^(n(n+1)/2) = sum_{n>=0} z^A00217(n). - _M. F. Hasler_, Oct 15 2014
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
